alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Sitka (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 14 at 10:51AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The Indian River near Sitka including within The National Park. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1047 AM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in areas around the Indian River including within the National Park. The river has reached bankfull stage and is still rising with another batch of heavy rain expected later today. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly, especially near the Indian River. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen since Wednesday evening. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible through Thursday night. - For Indian River at Sitka: At 10:30am the stage was 24.73 feet. Flood Stage is 25.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 26.0 feet is expected around 4:00pm Thursday before river levels begin to fall. - If you live near or along the Indian River stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
